intro: Conchocarpus santosii, commonly known as the Santosii mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhizophoraceae. It is native to the coastal regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. This plant is characterized by its ability to thrive in saline and brackish water environments, making it an important component of mangrove ecosystems. It has aerial roots that help in anchoring the plant and absorbing oxygen from the air. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and red fruits that contain a single seed.
